channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Banned! The Mary Whitehouse Story
channel.desc: The story of a Midlands housewife and her 30-year battle to save Britain's morals. Contains some strong language and scenes of a sexual nature.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Banned! The Mary Whitehouse Story
channel.desc: Mary's campaigns against pornography and 'video nasties' raise her profile still further. Contains sexual content and disturbing scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Confucius
channel.desc: Bettany Hughes visits China on the trail of Confucius, a great sage of Chinese history.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Story of Welsh Art
channel.desc: Huw Stephens looks at how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
channel.desc: Monty Don visits South America, which has more than 50,000 endemic plant species.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.title: This is BBC Four

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
channel.desc: Documentary series celebrating Britain's rich industrial heritage, presented by Fred Dibnah. This programme examines the early use of wind and water power.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Railways
channel.desc: Exploring how Britain's expanding rail network sparked a social revolution. How do you organise a network in a country of separate time zones and no recognised timetables.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
channel.desc: Technical problems frustrate Bendor and Emma's investigation of a 300-year-old portrait.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff
channel.desc: Robert Robinson presides as Frank Muir, Sue Cook and Bryan Forbes take on Arthur Marshall, Nanette Newman, Paul Eddington in a duel of words and wit.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Arianna Stassinopoulos, Richard Baker and David Attenborough. With guest musician Erich Leinsdorf.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Orson Welles Story
channel.desc: Profile of Orson Welles, looking at his life and career in theatre, radio and particularly film. This part deals with his work up to Touch of Evil.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Orson Welles Story
channel.desc: Profile of Orson Welles, looking at films including The Trial, Chimes at Midnight, The Immortal Story and F for Fake and discussing his unfinished projects, including Don Quixote.

channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
channel.desc: Documentary series celebrating Britain's rich industrial heritage, presented by Fred Dibnah. This programme examines the early use of wind and water power.

channel.desc: Exploring how Britain's expanding rail network sparked a social revolution. How do you organise a network in a country of separate time zones and no recognised timetables.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Arianna Stassinopoulos, Richard Baker and David Attenborough. With guest musician Erich Leinsdorf.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Oak Tree
channel.desc: George McGavin investigates the dramatic life of the oak tree - a species that makes extraordinary transformations as it meets the challenges of the four seasons.

channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
channel.desc: Documentary series celebrating Britain's rich industrial heritage, presented by Fred Dibnah. Tracing the development of Britain's textile industry.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Railways
channel.desc: Series about Britain's railways. Liz McIvor explores how railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, including how business was done.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Two Ronnies Sketchbook
channel.desc: The Two Ronnies delve into the backstage stories behind classic comedy moments as they reveal memories from their impressive careers. Including the 'fork handles' sketch.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Porridge
channel.desc: Fletcher inadvertently becomes involved in the murky world of drugs.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Many Faces of Ronnie Barker
channel.desc: A portrait of Ronnie Barker, one of the country's favourite comedy stars. With contributions from Ben Elton, Michael Grade, David Renwick and Josephine Tewson.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Holding Liat - Storyville
channel.desc: A Storyville documentary following the family of Liat Beinin Atzili, kidnapped from Israel on 7 October 2023, as they try to secure her release.
